alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 01 at 5:56PM MST until January 02 at 9:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 9 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Just before 6 PM Saturday, Blackfeet Law Enforcement reports whiteout conditions all across the area.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock, please visit our webpage and select Local Programs, then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
